page.title: 13Kingstone Minerals Quarry
page.content: The quarry has been operating for about 70 years and is owned by {Kingstone Minerals Ltd.}25 people, including a manager and weighbridge operator, are employed. The quarry totals about 55 acres in area, including a new field of 23 acres. They start quarrying the new field by first taking off the topsoil. The second layer is hardcore, the third is used as walling stone which is a creamy white colour. The fourth layer is used as building stone for houses or it is crushed for making concrete slabs and roadways. The building stone is cut into manageable pieces and taken into a barn to be cut to size by a clipper saw. There it is cut into brick-like pieces for house building. The lime is the waste from the crushed stone which is put through a mill and ground into dust.
